Job Title: Robotics Engineer - Control Algorithms | Autonomous Mining Technology
Ad Text:
Are you an experienced Robotics Engineer with strong control algorithms expertise and a passion for high-quality engineering? Join a global leader in underground autonomous mining equipment and help refine the controllability and performance of advanced remote-controlled, semi-autonomous and fully autonomous machines.

This role is based in North-West Melbourne within a highly skilled product development team working across an integrated technology ecosystem — including onboard and offboard software, production monitoring, and real-time fleet management systems.
You’ll work on meaningful, cutting-edge technology — and continually learn, collaborate, and grow your professional network.

What you’ll be doing

Develop and optimise control strategies and algorithms for autonomous and remote-operated mining equipment
Work within the Underground Technology Controls Software Team, collaborating closely with engineers, architects and stakeholders
Apply Scrum and SAFe Agile practices to deliver high-quality software to agreed scope and timelines
Research, design and validate control software to meet performance, safety and reliability requirements
Troubleshoot complex systems, identify root causes and resolve software and architecture issues
Participate in code reviews, design reviews and validation activities to ensure uncompromised quality
What you’ll bring

Bachelor’s, Master’s or PhD in Engineering (Robotics, Mechatronics, Control, Electrical or similar)
3+ years’ experience in robotics, controls or autonomous systems
Strong analytical mindset with deep understanding of control theory
Proven experience in algorithm development, modelling, simulation and performance analysis
Advanced skills in C++ and Python with strong object-oriented programming capability
Experience developing multi-threaded embedded applications and debugging complex systems
It’s a bonus if you also have

Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Knowledge of software engineering best practice, design patterns and TDD
Ability to work independently and contribute in cross-functional environments
Experience with Linux, microservices, databases, middleware or interface systems
A proactive, problem-solving mindset and continuous improvement attitude
The details

Contract: 12 months initially — strong potential for rolling extensions
Location: North-West Melbourne — onsite 5 days per week (with flexibility where needed)
Travel: You'll need to visit the proving ground in Tasmania as required
Work rights: You must have the right to work in Australia

Interested?
Contact Fortunato (“Forty”) Galluzzo �� 043 870 9417 or ✉️ forty@taskgroup.com.au

Deep knowledge of LLMs, vector databases, embeddings and agent orchestration tools

Build agentic and GenAI systems for major clients
Join a high calibre engineering team working with world class partners
Competitive salary, share options and full benefits package
Hybrid working model with flexibility for key client delivery

About Us: 

We are proudly owned by Auto & General Insurance Company. The A&G group is made up of trusted and well-known brands such as iSelect, Compare the Market and Budget Direct. In late 2024, iSelect and Compare the Market formed a new aggregation business within the A&G group that continues to support millions of Australians to compare and buy their personal finance, and household products such as insurance, energy, and loans.

The Opportunity: 

Ready to take your data career to the next level? Compare the Market is looking for a talented Data Engineer to help shape our data platform and drive data-driven decisions across the business. You’ll design and optimise cloud-based data pipelines, frameworks, and tools, focusing on automation, scalability, and innovation—all while supporting our ambitious growth and data strategy.

Design, build, and maintain robust, scalable data pipelines and integrations aligned with data architecture standards.
Write, test, and deploy high-quality code while managing releases, reviews, and delivery risks.
Collaborate with Data Architects to support governance, quality, master data, and metadata management.
Partner with BI and reporting teams to optimise the data warehouse for analytics and insights.
Monitor and improve data quality, ensuring accuracy, integrity, and reliability across systems.

Benefits:

At Compare the Market and iSelect we offer a dynamic and collaborative work environment where your talents will be recognised and rewarded. You’ll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact and contribute to our continued success, we also provide:

Vibrant and social community who have annual celebrations, family fun days and regular events.
Enjoy flexible work arrangements, including the option of one day working from home each week or a 9-day fortnight.
Enjoy additional leave days - ‘ME’ leave and ‘Volunteer Day’ leave.
Employee discounts on Car, Home, Travel insurance.
Income protection insurance provided to support you in the event of non-work-related illness or injury.

 About you:

Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, IT, or a related field, with 5+ years in IT/data and 3+ years in a data engineering role.
Proven experience with cloud-based data platforms (AWS and/or GCP), Data Lakes, and Information Governance tools (Lineage, Glossary, Reference Data).
Strong Python and ETL development skills, with expertise in data modelling and metadata-driven, automated solutions.
Proficiency in deploying data workloads using CI/CD pipelines and familiarity with Databricks and on-premises EDW/ETL environments.
Deep understanding of the end-to-end Data & Insights lifecycle, ensuring data quality and governance.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with experience in Agile environments and tools like Jira and Confluence.

Want to know more? apply now!

At Compare the Market and iSelect and we’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and we embrace diversity.

This role is available to candidates with unlimited Australian working rights only.

Compare the Market and iSelect are committed to protecting your privacy. All applications and personal information are kept confidential and securely stored in line with Australian privacy laws, used only for recruitment purposes, and not shared with third parties outside the Auto & General Holdings Group without your consent.

About Additive Assurance

At Additive Assurance, we're solving a major problem in metal 3D printing: ensuring parts are made right, every time. Companies in critical industries like aerospace and medicine use 3D printing to create everything from jet engine components to surgical implants. However, tiny, random flaws can cause these crucial parts to fail.

Our unique technology uses sensors and software to monitor the printing process in real-time, catching defects as they happen. This leads to safer parts, less waste, and greater trust in 3D printing technology. Your work will help make this advanced manufacturing technique a reliable, everyday tool for engineers worldwide.

The Role

We're looking for a versatile and resourceful Junior Machine Learning Engineer to join our small, hands-on team. You'll tackle a range of challenges involving unique industrial sensor data, with a primary focus on the deep learning models that power our defect detection.

This is a role for a true problem-solver. You won't just be tuning hyperparameters in a vacuum; you'll be responsible for the entire ML lifecycle—from designing data pipelines and training architectures for 3D segmentation to optimising models for the edge and integrating them into production code. This is a role for a builder; you'll be shipping solutions in a fast-moving environment where your work makes a tangible impact on physical manufacturing.

A Note On Our Culture: Is This Role For You?

We are a team of fast builders and tinkerers who thrive on rapid iteration and tangible results. We believe in moving quickly, learning from the results, and continuously improving.

To succeed in this role, you will need to learn quickly and adapt as you go. If you prefer a slower, more guided work environment, or if your passion lies more in theoretical research than in hands-on building and deployment, this might not be the role for you. We are looking for people who are driven by the process of creating, deploying, and seeing their solutions used in the real world.

What You'll Do

Design & Deploy: Train and refine deep learning models for classification and segmentation of unique sensor data.

ML Frameworks: Support the development of our ML framework, specifically focusing on image and 3D data.

Experiment at the Edge: Design and run experiments to push the performance of ML models on real-world hardware.

End-to-End Ownership: Learn and participate in the entire ML lifecycle, from data pre-processing through to model evaluation.

Collaborate: Work closely with our software engineering team to integrate models into our production software stack.

What You'll Bring

A Builder's Mindset: A genuine passion for machine learning and a strong desire to see your models solve real-world problems.

Technical Foundation: Solid knowledge of machine learning concepts, demonstrated through projects.

Deep Learning Tools: Hands on experience with frameworks like PyTorch or TensorFlow.

Python Proficiency: Strong familiarity with Python and its data science ecosystem (e.g., NumPy, Pandas).

Right to Work: You must have the right to work in Australia.

Bonus Points: Exposure to 3D data processing, computer vision, and software engineering practices (Git, Docker, Linux) is highly regarded.

What We Offer

Salary: Annual salary of $75,000 - $90,000 + super (pro-rata for part-time).

Invest in Your Growth: We provide dedicated, paid time for guided and self-directed learning to help you build a world-class foundation in ML.

Meaningful Equity: Through our employee share scheme, you'll have a real stake in our success.

The Mission: The opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology that is actively shaping the future of global manufacturing.

Collaborative Environment: A dynamic and flexible work environment at our Oakleigh office.

Ready to Join Us?

If you're a junior ML enthusiast who loves solving problems and wants to make a significant impact in a growing company, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to be part of our journey to revolutionise manufacturing!

Apply here: https://additiveassurance.zohorecruit.com.au/jobs/Careers/12844000000302856/Junior-Machine-Learning-Engineer

Aspirante is working with a government organisation, with national reach to assist in their search for a Data Engineer to join a high-performing Data & Technology team delivering impactful data solutions that support evidence-based decision making.

You’ll work in a modern data environment, collaborating with data scientists, BI developers, and engineering peers to build secure, high-performance data pipelines, support enterprise analytics, and contribute to real-world outcomes across safety, regulation, and operational performance.

- Contract to June 30th 2026
- Paying up to $1000 incl super per day
- 50/50 Hyrbid setup (Parramatta)

What you’ll do
• Deliver high-quality data solutions as part of a high-performing Agile/SCRUM team
• Interpret business requirements and estimate, prioritise, and deliver work effectively
• Build, optimise and maintain data pipelines, integrations, and workflow automation
• Support and enhance existing infrastructure, deployments, and environments
• Participate in incident management, troubleshooting, monitoring, and RCA
• Provide technical guidance to junior engineers and cross-functional team members
• Conduct feasibility studies, POCs, and platform improvement research
• Contribute to CI/CD, testing, code reviews, and secure release practices

What you bring
• 4+ years’ experience as a Data Engineer
• Strong ETL/ELT, data modelling, RDBMS, schema design and SQL expertise
• Experience with Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Microsoft BI Stack, DevOps
• Proficiency in Python, Java, R, DAX or Power Query M
• Understanding of big data concepts — data lakes, streaming, governance, lineage
• Ability to solve complex problems, analyse systems, and optimise performance
• Strong communication skills, collaboration mindset, and attention to detail
• Experience working in Agile/SCRUM environments

To apply in strict confidence, click the apply now button. Alternatively if you would like to discuss this role in more detail, please feel free to email chenderson@aspirante.com.au to arrange a call.

Salary: No contractor fees / two pay runs per week
Ad Text:
IT Technical Lead – Data & Analytics 6-month contract | Brisbane + WFH

We’re recruiting an experienced IT Technical Lead – Data & Analytics to support a significant Operational Technology (OT) uplift program within a large Queensland-based utilities organisation. This role will play a key part in delivering modern, scalable data and analytics solutions that replace manual, paper-based processes and improve data quality across operational environments.

Operating across both IT and OT domains, you will provide hands-on technical leadership across ServiceNow, data ingestion pipelines and Power BI, while guiding solution design, development standards and delivery outcomes across a multi-stream program of work.




Key Responsibilities:

· Lead the architecture and design of enterprise data solutions leveraging ServiceNow, SQL databases, ETL processes and APIs

· Define best practices for data modelling, storage, integration and performance across on-prem and cloud platforms

· Provide hands-on technical leadership, including code reviews, technical documentation and adherence to development standards

· Design and implement robust data ingestion pipelines to support operational data collection, collation and reporting

· Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards and reporting solutions aligned to business and operational needs

· Work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into scalable, actionable data solutions

· Deliver data and analytics initiatives end-to-end, ensuring timelines, quality and outcomes are achieved

· Implement data governance controls, security standards, access management and audit requirements




What we’re looking for:

· Demonstrated experience leading technical teams across data and analytics initiatives

· Strong hands-on expertise with ServiceNow,, SQL Server, ETL tools and Power BI

· Experience configuring ServiceNow Mobile App Builder, Form Designer and Mobile Agent (including offline access)

· Ability to configure Dispatcher Workspace, dynamic scheduling and work order templates

· Experience using Flow Designer and Business Rules to streamline Field Service Management processes

· Strong understanding of data architecture, data warehousing and cloud technologies (e.g. Databricks)

· Proficiency in JavaScript, Glide API and REST/SOAP integrations

· Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices in data environments

Desirable:

· ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CSA)

· ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD)

· Certified Implementation Specialist – Field Service Management (CIS-FSM)

· Experience working across complex IT / OT environments




Why apply through Lime Recruitment?

Enjoy two pay runs per week without contractor fees. As a Queensland-owned agency, we offer personalised service and are a Tier 1 supplier to the Queensland Government. Awarded Australia’s top-performing small agency in 2021 and 2022, with a finalist spot in 2023. Partner with Lime for genuine, experienced, friendly recruiters dedicated to securing the best opportunities for you.

Apply now or contact Daniel Keyte on 0433 013 200 or daniel@limejobs.com.au to find out more.

Infrastructure Engineer

12 month contract

Sydney

A large enterprise organisation is looking for an experienced Infrastructure Engineer to join their Servers & Platforms team on a 12-month contract. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys reviewing existing environments, improving stability and performance, and producing high-quality documentation to support future transformation work.

You'll work across both on-premises and cloud environments, helping uplift core infrastructure, enhance security, streamline operations, and support ongoing technology modernisation.

What You'll Be Doing

Conduct a full review of current infrastructure across on-prem and cloud platforms.
Identify optimisation opportunities across performance, capacity, security, and cost-efficiency.
Develop detailed documentation including architecture diagrams, runbooks, SOPs, and configuration records.
Work collaboratively with internal IT teams and external vendors to validate configurations and industry best practice.
Support the uplift and hardening of infrastructure services to meet evolving compliance and operational standards.
Contribute to cloud re-platforming initiatives, particularly within Microsoft Azure.
Provide Level 3 support for infrastructure-related issues throughout the contract.
Support knowledge transfer, training, and onboarding of internal team members.

Key Technologies You'll Work With

Cloud & Virtualisation: Azure, VMware vSphere, Hyper-V, Azure Virtual Desktop
Security: Azure AD, Certificate Services, Palo Alto, Mimecast, Microsoft Purview
Networking: Cisco, Palo Alto, VPN, SD-WAN
Automation: PowerShell, Power Automate
Monitoring & Backup: SolarWinds, Rubrik, Azure Site Recovery, PowerBI
Collaboration & Productivity: Microsoft 365, Teams, SharePoint
Databases: Microsoft SQL
Industry Systems (nice to have): iManage, Intapp, Elite 3E

What You Bring

5+ years' experience supporting and implementing multi-site infrastructure environments.
Strong hands-on experience with Azure, VMware, and Windows Server technologies.
Solid understanding of Active Directory (on-prem + cloud), networking fundamentals, load balancing, and virtual desktop technologies.
Experience maintaining system documentation, BCP/DR plans, and operational runbooks.
Ability to provide technical leadership and communicate effectively with stakeholders.
Comfortable working under pressure, managing multiple priorities, and delivering to deadlines.
Certifications such as ITIL, CCNP, VCP, MCITP are highly regarded.
Experience in regulated or professional-services environments (legal, financial, consulting) is a bonus.

At Google, we have a vision of empowerment and equitable opportunity for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and commit to building reconciliation through Google’s technology, platforms and people and we welcome Indigenous applicants. Please see our Reconciliation Action Plan for more information.

Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.

2 years of experience with software development in any general purpose programming language (e.g., C++, Java, Golang, or Python).

Preferred qualifications:

Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science, or a related technical field.
2 years of experience with data structures and algorithms.
Experience in industry standard programming languages such as Golang and C++.
Experience in developing or working with distributed or large cloud based software systems.
Experience in building software applications in the networking, infrastructure, and security domains.
About the job


Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

With your technical expertise, you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.

Google's Global Network Security team are responsible for the full lifecycle of a massive, web-scale network that reaches from core data centers to edge locations, providing the foundation for services like Gemini, Gmail, Search, and YouTube, while also supporting cloud networking for Google Cloud Platform (GCP) customers and AI/ML initiatives.

Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

Work with our peer teams in understanding the workflows and issues, train and land features.
Design and implement services to scan millions of assets and report vulnerabilities.

Develop and maintain security services to manage security artifacts used by Google's global infrastructure.
Work with the cross-functional team partners to understand their requirements and build the products to meet those requirements.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

At AustralianSuper, we truly care about our colleagues.​ We know work and life are intertwined. That’s why we support the diverse needs of everyone and have policies that enable us all to thrive and be truly flexible. We ensure diversity is celebrated for the opportunity it provides us all to learn and grow and deliver better outcomes for members. We are dedicated to building a high-performance environment underpinned by a strong risk culture, ensuring we deliver the best outcomes for our members.

Your New Role 

Reporting to the Chief Platform Officer, the Head of AI and Automation Services is a senior leader responsible for enabling the Funds ambition to use technology as a differentiator for the future.

The Head of AI and Automation Services will work across the Fund, including Member and Investment domains and is responsible for ensuring that the design and implementation of AI and enabling colleagues to adopt AI across the Fund and deliver AI enabled outcomes for members.

The Head of AI and Automation plays a pivotal strategic role in advancing the Fund’s digital and AI automation maturity, operational resilience, and capacity for innovation.

Key duties include but are not limited to:

Thought leadership on the direction of AI, trends and identify opportunities for the Fund.
Champion the Fund’s enterprise AI & hyper automation strategy to optimise business processes, enhance operational capabilities, and drive digital transformation.
Provide visionary leadership, setting the direction for AI & hyper automation initiatives that align with the Fund’s long-term objectives and member-first philosophy. 
Collaborate with Executives, business stakeholders and IT leaders to ensure automation strategies are integrated with broader organisational goals. 
Understand the global AI governance and risk management practices to ensure that the Fund aligns to regulatory and industry guidelines.
Identify and assess emerging trends in AI, including GenAI, Agentic AI, machine learning (ML), power automation (PA), intelligent process automation (IPA), and their application to the Fund’s operations
Promote a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the Technology Digital and Data domain and across the Fund.
Engage with internal and external stakeholders to identify AI and automation opportunities, manage expectations, and communicate progress and value delivered.
Ensure relevant legislative and organisational requirements are met; keep up to date on all key changes to relevant regulations.
Lead the AI & automation team to implement and scale new ways of working, and deliver outcomes at pace.

What You’ll Need   

Extensive experience (10+ years) in IT, digital transformation or process automation, with demonstrated leadership in large-scale AI and automation initiatives. 
Demonstrated track record of successful delivery of enterprise automation projects, including AI/ML, BPM, RPA and analytics solutions. 
Expert knowledge of AI and automation platforms (e.g., Microsoft Power Platform, Microsoft AI, OpenAI, ServiceNow, cloud technologies and other Gen AI services). 
Deep knowledge in data management and data practices.
Familiarity with data analytics, cybersecurity, compliance frameworks and COBIT/ITIL service management. 
Relevant certifications in automation, AI, and project management frameworks (e.g., Lean, Agile/Scrum, ITIL, Microsoft certifications) highly desirable. 
Proven ability to establish and manage Centres of Excellence (CoE), including governance, quality assurance and continuous improvement standards. 
Exceptional stakeholder engagement and communication skills, with experience influencing senior executives and preparing executive-level reports, business cases and dashboards.

We cultivate a workplace that champions safety, respect, inclusiveness and diversity.  We are committed to supporting our diverse workforce in a way that is inclusive and embraces diversity in all its forms.
